description: runtime: fix "SysReserve returned unaligned address" bug on 32-bit systems

messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=1f2a839158ce ***

runtime: fix "SysReserve returned unaligned address" bug on 32-bit systems

R=rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5642064

Committer: Nigel Tao <nigeltao@golang.org>

This CL fixed the recent linux/386 and linux/arm build breakage.

http://build.golang.org/log/9da48323cb07fb5401de83dcc294013725db4303
http://build.golang.org/log/1d05f134ff397362df788ea1db65e63fc7f3c402

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Thanks; please move the p = nil down into the code section.
This is an old-style C file, with a declaration block without
initializations and then code afterward.

done. PTAL.

On Thu, Feb 9, 2012 at 5:40 AM, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> Thanks; please move the p = nil down into the code section.
> This is an old-style C file, with a declaration block without
> initializations and then code afterward.
>
